title: League of Legends Not opening
body: Already posted a support ticket on this, haven't had a response in 24 hours. Recently updated to windows 10 creators update. After the update, I couldn't open league. I've looked at many threads and suggestions, but none of them work. The badge will just flash, the loading bar will go to around 50%, then fade away. Having this problem for 2 days so far, extremely frustrating. Anyone know a fix?

replies.body: After updating to Windows 10 Creator were you able to reset your permissions? Typically when the launcher won't open it's due to your OS blocking the program before it's able to open correctly, so let's make sure to double check those [**permissions**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) first. Hit me back up if that doesn't seem to help at all though!

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=BZuEb6uk,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-07-08T03:04:39.553+0000)
>
> After updating to Windows 10 Creator were you able to reset your permissions? Typically when the launcher won't open it's due to your OS blocking the program before it's able to open correctly, so let's make sure to double check those [**permissions**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) first. Hit me back up if that doesn't seem to help at all though!

I may of found the problem. In Task Manager, LoL Patcher, Pvp.net Patcher Kernel, and Riot Client Patcher are all running in the background as 32 bit, but my computer is 64 bit.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=BZuEb6uk,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-07-08T03:04:39.553+0000)
>
> After updating to Windows 10 Creator were you able to reset your permissions? Typically when the launcher won't open it's due to your OS blocking the program before it's able to open correctly, so let's make sure to double check those [**permissions**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) first. Hit me back up if that doesn't seem to help at all though!

Already tried all that and was instructed to do that. Nothing.
Now its saying "Failed to lauch RADS/system/rads_user_kernel.exe"
